New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2024 年 11 月 14 日星期四 02:45:24 +0000 zh 1每小时1
Hīkoi to Parliament: Communities unite in Tairāwhiti for Toitū Te Tiriti hīkoi https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/hikoi-to-parliament-communities-unite-in-tairawhiti-for-toitu-te-tiriti-hikoi/DQ5O2OBK2FBFVDURPFNAOAEOFQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/hikoi-to-parliament-communities-unite-in-tairawhiti-for-toitu-te-tiriti-hikoi/DQ5O2OBK2FBFVDURPFNAOAEOFQ/ Matai O'Connor, Kaupapa Māori reporterMauri stone 'Mauri Tū, Mauri Ora' passed to communities, honouring ancestors and future. Thu, 14 Nov 2024 02:36:21 +0000 Around 400 people took part in a hīkoi that started at Tapuaeroa Rd and went over Rotokautuku Bridge and through to Kariaka Marae near Ruatōria. Photo / Hiko Media House

Photo / Mark Mitchell

Environmental Protection Authority looks to ban insecticide chlorpyrifoshttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/environmental-protection-authority-looks-to-ban-insecticide-Chlorpyrifos/37VJQF2BQNDIZONATI2DUG2H5Q/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/environmental-protection-authority-looks-to-ban-insecticide-Chlorpyrifos/37VJQF2BQNDIZONATI2DUG2H5Q/ Chlorpyrifos is for professional use only as it is toxic to people and the environment. Thu, 14 Nov 2024 02:00:00 +0000 Chlorpyrifos is banned in Canada, not approved in the EU and under review in the US. File photo / 123rf

Trec to finish Tairāwhiti highway cyclone recovery by mid-2026 https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/trec-to-finish-tairawiti-highway-cyclone-recovery-by-mid-2026/NPDKXU746RDADB5FGVX2D6ZJEA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/trec-to-finish-tairawiti-highway-cyclone-recovery-by-mid-2026/NPDKXU746RDADB5FGVX2D6ZJEA/ Wynsley WrigleyLocal contractors handle 80% of Trec work; 'highways are in great shape,' says councillor Thu, 14 Nov 2024 01:44:44 +0000 Hikuwai No 1 Bridge on SH35 was taken out in Cyclone Gabrielle. Final Transport Rebuild East Coast recovery projects at Hikuwai Bridge, Mangahauini Bridge and Ōtoko Hill will be completed by mid-2026. Photo / Liam Clayton
